N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 429.3 - Test method

State Regulations
(a) Testing of
cigarettes shall be conducted in accordance with the American Society of

Testing and Materials ("ASTM") standard E2187-02b "Standard Test Method for

Measuring the Ignition Strength of Cigarettes," subject to the modifications
stated in Appendix A to this Part. This standard may be obtained from the
publisher at ASTM International, 100 Barr Harbor Drive, P.O. Box C700, W. Conshohocken, PA 19428-2959. This material is available for public inspection
and distribution at the Department of State, Office of Fire Prevention and

Control, 41 State Street, Albany, NY 12231-0001. (b) Testing shall be conducted on 10 layers
of filter paper. (c) Forty
replicate tests shall comprise a complete test trial for each cigarette
tested. (d) The performance
standard required by section
429.4
of this Part shall only be
applied to a complete test trial. (e) Laboratories conducting testing in
accordance with this section shall implement a quality control and quality
assurance program that includes a procedure that will determine the
repeatability of the testing results. The repeatability value shall be no
greater than 0.19 pursuant to section
429.4
of this Part. Notes
